title_sort: elmer e. stafford to walt whitman, 9 november 1877
title: Elmer E. Stafford to Walt Whitman, 9 November 1877
text: Nov.November 9, 1877.Dear sir.I am well and hope you the same I would be very glad to see you as i did expect to come down you to daytoday or i would of wrote sooner. and if nothing hapins[happens] I will be down next wensday[Wednesday] night and stay until thursday night I would like very much to see you you must rite[write] right a way[away] and tell me how you are a getting along I would like to be with you all the time if i could i would like very much to go with you on your trip to washington. we are very buisy[busy] husking just now and will be fore[for] a few days and we will have nothing to do for a while)I am in a hurry i cant rite[write] any so it is good by[goodbye] i hope you wellElmer E. StaffordGlendaleToWalt. WhitmanNJ Elmer E. Stafford to Walt Whitman, 9 November 1877
